column4: Hi! I've got a technical question. My PC is 'getting old' and I want to change to some lightweight distro and I wonder is there truly a diffrence between a light-distro (like Crunchbang or Lubuntu) and using Ubuntu with fluxbox or openbox? Is it really more 'light'?
I use ubuntu with fluxbox and its very light / configurable
Well, I have Sempron 2000Mhz and 1GB of RAM and my Ubuntu is running slower and slower, that's the emergency call so I'm looking for some alternative :)
